intro: Aristoclesia esculenta, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that resemble small bells. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers bloom in clusters and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. The plant is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some indigenous communities.
